Data.Name: Pasta with Homemade Tomato Sauce
Data.Description: I came up with this recipe when I had some leftover canned tomatoes and decided to come up with a quick pasta sauce.  Normally I would have added basil to the sauce, but since I had some oregano on hand and I decided to use it instead.  I also threw in a few sundried tomatoes to sweeten the sauce a bit.  This is a quick and easy complete meal when served with a fresh green salad.

Data.Name: 150 Calorie Lemon Drop
Data.Description: At a bar or cocktail lounge, lemon drops can be hundreds of calories.  In this recipe, less sugar is used since Grand Marnier already gives a slightly sweet flavor to the drink.  The use of a high quality vodka helps to tame the drink and gives it a smooth finish.

Data.Name: Chocolate Ice Cream
Data.Description: Plan to start making this truffle-rich ice cream five days before you serve it and you'll be rewarded for the waiting. It took the chefs at St. John years to arrive at this recipe. We're glad they did.

Data.Name: Chocolate Hazelnut Spirals
Data.Description: Pinwheel cookies have long been a traditional holiday cookie. Make the dough one day and bake the cookies another day.

Data.Name: Lobster and Avocado Salad
Data.Description: The sweet tender flavor of lobster paired with the creaminess of the avocado makes this a great starter for a summertime dinner or lunch.

Data.Name: Lemon Risotto with Roasted Cherry Tomatoes
Basil Pesto
Data.Description: I almost always make pesto anytime I have leftover basil from other recipes.  For a little acidity I add some lemon juice.  The lemon juice also helps to keep the basil leaves green.

Data.Name: Mediterranean Frittata
Data.Description: This healthy yet tasty frittata filled with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes and feta cheese is perfect for a weekend brunch.

Data.Name: Potato-Mushroom Gratin
Data.Description: Luscious and satisfyingâ€”a little goes a long way. Make the gratin up to one day ahead. Before serving, cut it into pieces and rewarm in the oven.

Data.Name: Apricots n Cream Cookies
Data.Description: The sour cream in this recipe creates a delicious moist cookie.

Data.Name: Quick Nectarine Cheese Danish
Data.Description: Store bought puff pastry dough saves a ton of time on this delicious danish.  Any fruit, in season, can be substituted for the nectarines.

Data.Name: Pan Seared Scallops with Saffron Beurre Blanc
Data.Description: These succulent scallops with a delicate saffron beurre blanc sauce are great as a starter or first course.

Data.Name: Swordfish with Olive, Pine Nut, and Parsley Relish
Ice Cream
Data.Description: Yummylicious I scream for that ice cream.

Data.Name: Mediterranean Frittata
Data.Description: This healthy yet tasty frittata filled with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes and feta cheese is perfect for a weekend brunch.

Data.Name: Crostini with Quail Egg and Prosciutto
Data.Description: This elegant crostini is easy to make and good for any occasion.

Data.Name: Sweet Hot Mustard Chicken Thighs
Data.Description: When it comes to mustard, sweet-hot works amazingly well, especially as a glaze for chicken. Even though we are using skin-on bone-in chicken thighs, I'm sure it will work with any cut of chicken. By the time this is done, it doesn't have a super-strong mustard flavor. It gets mellowed out by the brown sugar and spices. The old saying 'The closer the bone, the sweeter the meat' really is true. Leaving in the bones adds a lot of flavor and juiciness.
